Hi Luke, 

Done updating the copy on the Omni Cargo Tanks North America page. 

Here's the link;
https://omnitanker.com/products/omni-cargo-tanks-north-america/

Let me know if you would like further changes.

Hi Heath,



Can you please arrange a text update to the following page, https://omnitanker.com/products/omni-cargo-tanks-north-america/:









Insert the following text and replace existing hyperlinks where originally present:

*** Start Text ***

Omni Tanker has developed specialised Cargo Tanks for the North American chemical transport market. These are large volume pressure tanks with a capacity of 5,500 US Gallons (20,800 litres) when used on semi-trailers, or 2,850 US Gallons (10,800 litres) when used for mini-bulk units. They have a test pressure of 60 psig (4.1 bar) and a maximum allowable working pressure (MAWP) of 40 psig (2.75 bar). Omni Cargo Tanks are also certified in a range of different volumes and configurations, so other sizes are possible.

The Cargo Tanks are produced by Omni Tanker, and the chassis manufacture and assembly undertaken by our USA based trailer partners to complete the Cargo Tank Motor Vehicle (CTMV).

These CTMVs are approved for the transport of Class 5 and Class 8 chemicals throughout North America. They are certified as a Specification 407 / 412 CTMV under United States Department of Transportation 49 CFR, and TC-407 / 412 Highway Tank by Transport Canada under CSA B620.

The Cargo Tank is manufactured using Omni Tanker's patented technology. The inside of the tank is a completely seamless thermoplastic corrosion barrier with no welds or joins, called the OmniSHIELD™. The outside of the tank is a high strength and lightweight carbon fibre reinforced polymer (CFRP) structure, the OmniFORT™, and the two layers are connected with Omni Tanker's high strength interface technology, OmniBIND™.

The seamless thermoplastic corrosion barrier provides a thick and durable interior to the tank that is highly resistant to damage or flaking to ensure high purity loads. The carbon fibre composite structure provides the ultimate in lightweight and high strength to maximise payloads. The interface between these structures creates a tank with the greatest safety for high consequence liquids.

The CTMV is fitted with a high-quality liquid handling fitout, which complements the chemically resistant Cargo Tank, making the units suitable for long term service with aggressive corrosive and oxidising chemicals. The exceptional chemical resistance, combined with high payload capacity, makes the Omni Cargo Tank the new standard for aggressive corrosive chemical transport in North America.

Our staff can discuss your specific transport and chemical compatibility needs to determine the right choice for you. Feel free to drop us a line.

*** End Text ***



Best regards,



Luke Djukic

















Dr Luke Djukic (PhD, BE, CPEng, FIEAust, NER, APEC Engineer, IntPE(Aus), RPEQ)

Chief Technical Officer

Rica,

Can you please make a change to one of the Directors CV on the About Us page

Ben Gust is a Managing Partner at Virescent Ventures, which continues on from the $200m Clean Energy Innovation Fund at the Clean Energy Finance Corporation (CEFC), where Ben lead a portfolio of investments in innovative, fast growth businesses with the ability to make a significant contribution to the growth of the clean energy sector. Before joining the CEFC Ben was a Managing Director of GBS Venture Partners, one of Australia's leading life-science Venture Capital firms where he worked for 15 years and remains a Director. Ben holds a Victorian legal practicing certificate, earned his Bachelor of Law and Bachelor of Science degrees from Monash University and has a Graduate Diploma in Applied Finance and Investment. He has held a number of Australian and US board roles with innovative technology companies such as Hatchtech Pty Ltd, Spinifex Inc, Ivantis Inc. and many others.

Daniel Rodgers

Managing Director

OMNI TANKER Pty. Ltd.

full_threads.body:
Hi Rica,

Thanks for this support. Please make the following additional changes.


  1. Please remove the inverted comma at the end of the following:






  1. Under https://omnitanker.com/about-us/ please change the following:



Change 2A:



Replace "CRAIG STUART, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER" with "KEVIN FINE, CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER"

Replace associated Biography text as follows:

Kevin is an experienced CFO and financial professional with proven track record of delivering results in growth companies. Kevin brings hands-on experience in both privately held and public listed companies in a diverse range of sectors including manufactured goods and technology, with experience in private equity and venture capital investment.

Change 2B:



Add TOPAZ CONWAY, NON-EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR

Add the following Bio text:

Topaz Conway has over 25 years proven experience in Strategic Business Growth, Investment/Fundraising, Innovation & Commercialisation in the United States and Australia. Topaz currently holds non-executive directorships on a number of fast growth companies undertaking international commercialisation of novel technologies. Topaz is a member of the Australian Institute of Company Directors, and is a director at Cicada Innovations, INCO Australia and Neurara Inc.

Change 2C:



Replace "BEN GUST, DIRECTOR" with "BEN GUST, NON-EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR"

Replace "DAVID PATERSON, DIRECTOR" with "DAVID PATERSON, NON-EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR"

Replace "JOHN HANDS, DIRECTOR" with "JOHN HANDS, NON-EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR"


  1. On home page https://omnitanker.com/ there are four cycling photos.



Replace the following image with the attachment (IMG_2481.jpeg) in which the blue logo on near the front of the tanker is removed (cropping image appropriately to mimic existing).



On https://omnitanker.com/products/chemical-road-tanker/ make similar change to the following image:



On https://omnitanker.com/products/omni-cargo-tanks-north-america/ make similar change to the following image:



Best regards,

Luke Djukic

T: [url=+61%202%204647%207557]+61 (0) 2 4647 7557 M: [url=+61%202%204647%207557]+61 (0) 423 851 880

Hi Heath,

As indicated by Daniel, we will be sending a series of updates for the website.

This is the second (first sent by Daniel this morning in relation to the staff).

On the following page, please update the text highlighted by the red box below:



Updated text:

"OMNI SULPHURIC ACID TANK

Through a program of extensive independent chemical testing, followed by long term field trial, Omni Sulphuric acid tanks are approved for the transport of 98% Sulphuric acid as well Sulfuric acid in dilute concentrations. Omni Sulphuric acid tanks are available as a single large compartment with baffles, or multiple separate and sealed compartments with maximum volume of 8,600 litres, based on the requirements of Australian Standards.

READ MORE


Omni Sulphuric Acid tanks come in a range of tanker configurations which includes lead tanker, semitrailer, B-Double, or road train, with a total tanker capacity from 16,000 litres up to 56,000 litres. Alternative volumes can be customised as required by specific user requirements.
The exceptional corrosion resistance of the OmniSHIELD™ barrier means that the tank does not suffer from wall thinning due to acid de-concentration in the same way as stainless steel, providing durability in challenging acid transport conditions.
Single compartment tanks are equipped with the Omni Tankers seamless Mould in Baffle (MIB) technology for added security and longevity."


Best regards,


Luke Djukic

Dr Luke Djukic (PhD, BE, CPEng, FIEAust, NER, APEC Engineer, IntPE(Aus), RPEQ)

Chief Technical Officer
